_header: Ye shall be paid after your willfulness
_description: Charles d’Orléans, a roundel — fourteen lines

Grenoble873.Editions:
Champollion-Figeac,  Aime. 
             Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans.
         Paris, 1842: 267.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “An English Friend of Charles d’Orleáns.” 
             PMLA
         26 (1911): 142-180: 176.

BNfr25458.First Lines:
[Y]e shal be payd after your whylfulnesAnd blame nothyng but your
                    mysgouernans…
BNfr25458.Last Lines:
…But now my hert yn yngland or in franceYs go to seke other
                    nyw besynes
